sentence.Network_en: I know he did not leave any valid WILL because He died intestate.
sentence.Network_cn: 我知道他没有留下任何合法的意志因为他死了没有留下遗嘱.

sentence.Network_en: The administrator will need to refer to legislation covering administration of intestate estates.
sentence.Network_cn: 遗产管理人需要求助于有关无遗嘱遗产管理的立法.

sentence.Network_en: The thesis analyses the tendency in correlative aspects of testamental succession and intestate succession.
sentence.Network_cn: 从遗嘱继承制度和无遗嘱继承制度的相关方面可了解这一变迁.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin intestatus, from in- 'not' + testatus 'testified, witness' (see testate)

means.word_mean: 1. having made no legally valid will before death or not disposed of by a legal will;
